result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald V Davis

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  removal of current counsel.  (Reginald V. Davis - #2022008195, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Reginald V Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Reginald V Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court denied defense request to modify bail.  Defense is requesting a status conference hearing date. Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30- pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (19 pages) commencing 09-29-2022, by Kristin Menzia.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIMINARY COURT FOR BR 10:
Defendant Reginald V Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Reginald V Davis.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer E. Wozniak. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald V Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Reginald V Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a State V. Lee hearing.  Attorney Tom Harris is now the attorney of record.  Case is adjourned to 9-29-22 at 1:30 pm in Preliminary Hearing Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Reginald V Davis not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10
Defendant Reginald V Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Reginald V Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Reginald V Davis
Current: 2524 N 37TH St, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 320 East Center Street #306, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Court ordered no contact with CMR (5/26/09),; QDR (8/26/10),; CPR (6/26/13),;  MJD (4/14/17),; or KDD (9/19/18); 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reginald V Davis in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Reginald V Davis in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reginald V Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 14, 15, and 16. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 5 a sample of your DNA is required. If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
